definitions.body: Ammon, LXX Amman, Ammwn (As. Bît Ammanu COT:Gloss.); always (except 1Sa 11:11 [where however LXX rds. ´[[בְּנֵי ע]]], Ps 83:8, which have ´[[ע]] alone) [[בְּנֵי עַמּוֹן]], connected by J with [[בֶּן־עַמִּי]] son of Lot Ge 19:38 (and meaning of name doubtless sought herein by J; cf. II. [[עַם]]); people apparently akin to Isr., but usu. hostile, dwelling E. of Jordan, NE. of Moab, between Arnon and Jabbok: Nu 21:24, Nu 21:24 (JE), De 2:19, De 2:19, De 2:37, De 3:11, De 3:16, Jos 12:2, Jos 13:10 (D), v:Jos 13:25 (P), Ju Jdg 3:13, Jdg 10:6 + 25 t. Ju Jdg 10-12, 1Sa 11:11, 1Sa 12:12, 1Sa 14:47, 2Sa 8:12, 2Sa 10:1 + 14 t. 2Sa 10 – 2Sa 12, 2Sa 17:27, 1Ki 11:7, 1Ki 11:33, 2Ki 23:13, 2Ki 24:2, 1Ch 18:11 + 20 t. Ch, Am 1:13, Is 11:14, Je 9:25 + 9 t. Je, Zep 2:8, Zep 2:9, Ez Eze 21:25, Eze 21:28 + 5 t. Ez Eze 25, Da 11:41.—Vid. Che:Ammon in Ency. Bib.
